metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5078 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Insufficient validation of untrusted input in Blink's mailto: handling in Google Chrome prior to 59.0.3071.86 for Linux, Windows, and Mac allowed a remote attacker to perform command injection via a crafted HTML page, a similar issue to CVE-2004-0121. For example, characters such as * have an incorrect interaction with xdg-email in xdg-utils, and a space character can be used in front of a command-line argument.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5078` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu1.1360
chromium-browser-l10n - 59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu1.1360
chromium-chromedriver - 59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu1.1360
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu1.1360
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu1.1360
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu1.1360').
